This movie is amazing! I’m fond of action movies and Shang-Chi is just what I needed because of  the fight scenes that make it feel real. The CGI was also very impressive. The cliffhanger was also a bit predictable. The movie was full of action but it was also humorous because they made jokes while being in a serious situation. I don’t particularly like action movies but this really changed my perspective. I do like movies that feel adventurous and the movie was just that.

The comic relief was the best part, I guess if the c.g.i. and action isn’t going to impress anymore at least make the audience laugh.  Unfortunately there was just too much back & forth in timelines which, of course, makes for a fragmented story and one that spends a bit too much time on family drama.  After an hour or so, it becomes a story about a dysfunctional family infighting that just got worse as it progressed. It’s basically the Star Wars trilogy crammed into one movie... which makes it’s story just a 1/3 of what Star Wars story was.  Ultimately, there’s just too much that disengaged me; from the back & forth storytelling, to the subtitles, to a proxy villain until the final minutes when the final boss shows up with no build or purpose.
One of the best in my opinion.

Shang-Chi is an origin story done right. The cast is strong, the pacing flows well, the CGI and fight choreography look fantastic, and the humor strikes a solid balance without undercutting the drama. The characters are engaging, and the plot delivers exactly what you’d want from a superhero introduction.

It doesn’t try to reinvent the genre, but it doesn’t need to. Instead, it executes the formula with confidence, wrapped in a beautiful blend of Chinese folklore, striking visuals, and a standout score.

A stylish, well-crafted film — and absolutely worth watching.
